name: Earth sciences
description: As part of Physical sciences (under Natural Sciences), Earth sciences is the study of the composition, structure, and physical aspects of the Earth, including its hydrosphere and atmosphere.

name: Climate research
description: The scientific study of climate, defined as weather conditions averaged over a period of time, a key area within Earth sciences.

name: Geodesy
description: The Earth science of accurately measuring and understanding Earth's geometric shape, orientation in space, and gravitational field.

name: Geography (physical)
description: The branch of geography dealing with natural features and processes, as opposed to human or cultural factors, an integral part of Earth sciences.

name: Geology
description: The science that deals with the earth's physical structure and substance, its history, and the processes which act on it, a core discipline of Earth sciences.

name: Geomatics
description: The science and technology of geographically referencing information, which includes surveying, mapping, remote sensing, GIS, and GPS, within Earth sciences.

name: Geospatial technology
description: Refers to equipment used in visualization, measurement, and analysis of earth's features, typically involving GPS, GIS, and remote sensing, a component of Earth sciences.

name: Meteorology
description: The science dealing with the atmosphere and its phenomena, including weather and climate, a branch of Earth sciences.

name: Oceanography
description: The branch of science that deals with the physical and biological properties and phenomena of the sea, an important field within Earth sciences.

name: Seismology
description: The branch of science concerned with earthquakes and related phenomena, studied as part of Earth sciences.
